intro: Columnea argentea, commonly known as the silver flame or silver bell, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, clinging to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are usually glossy and dark green, often with a silver or white underside. Columnea argentea is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation under the right conditions.
